pageProps.title: To Ankita, who read my Work and Was Affected

children.value:
I drive my coach around about
The fountain in the centre, from
Which ancient water gushes out
And then I travel serpentine
To circle the adjacent square
And gaze into the centre, where
A statue holds a metal drum.
The wheels on cobblestones become
His beat; he walks, I drive in line
The running water travels on
The statue watches till it's gone.
